intro: Pratia conferta, commonly known as the clustered pratia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pratia conferta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
